headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; Correspondence and Miscellaneous Extracts. OUR BALTIMORE CORRESPONDENCE. THE DEATH OF SECESSION IN MARBLAND THE TROOPS AT THE RELAY, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secession in Mary and is not only sick, it is dead. The Up as tree, however, cannot at once, in all its roots, be so entirely eradicated, that it may not, under circumstances auspicious to its growth, here and there, occasionally, sprout up again. But, for the present, it has disappeared; and its wildes advocates admit, that any attempt at its resuscitation would, under the present condition of affairs, be not only vain, but mad.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM PENSACOLA.; PROBABLE INTENTIONS OF THE REBELS--PENSACOLA, WARRINGTON AND THE NAVY-YARD TO BE DESTROYED.ON BOARD THE U.S. CORVETTE ST. LOUIS.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the Wyandotte's men is going ashore this morning on a reconnoitering expedition divined by himself, and as Capt. ADAMS has found means to send off a letter-bag to-day, I thought it would be a good idea to tell you what takes "Jim" to the enemy's post.
